entry.title: Revert "[Desktop] Add an ESB promo IPH bubble on a dangerous download"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 368bfebe5aacbabcc9205f5ca9fcb8b9ae10038b.



Reason for revert: Seems to be causing consistent test failures in the linux-chromeos-chrome builder

i.e. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-chrome/37838/overview



Original change's description:

> [Desktop] Add an ESB promo IPH bubble on a dangerous download

>

> Adds a In-Product-Help (IPH) bubble to promote Enhanced Safe Browsing

> (ESB) when a user downloads a dangerous download for the first time.

> Users who have standard protection as their security setting can see

> this update. If the users select to enable ESB, it will navigate them

> to the chrome://settings/security page with another IPH bubble on top

> of the enhanced protection radio button to let them know how to enable

> ESB.

>

> Screencast:http://go/scrcast/NTk1NDEwMDY0OTc4NzM5MnxkODg5ZWMyYi1lNg

>

> Change-Id: Ia9aec9f3c4d8e5035e15318e228ea677e4385626

entry.title: Remove shared preference file helpers
entry.content:
The GVR tests that were recently removed were the only consumers of

shared preference files that allowed for setting/restoring some device

specific state during tests. Now that those tests and the shared

preference files themselves have been removed, we can remove the

utilities that supported them.



This was done as a separate change because there is one cleanup where

a script was leveraging a helper from the shared preference files

that was actually a bit more generic of functionality, however, the

bulk of this functionality is actually a no-op on Python 3. As such the

previous behavior was inlined.



Bug: 1510066

Change-Id: I8a7a60eb44a3a62dde790de1d1e65f8ec0962e21

entry.title: documentScan: Add handler to get option groups
entry.content:
getOptionGroups takes a scanner handle returned from openScanner and

queries the backend for the option groups for that scanner. All of the

work happens on the backend - this CL simply forwards messages back and

forth and converts messages.



Also did some cleanup in the mojom file and associated files. Updated

the GetOptionGroupsResponse message to change 'options' to 'groups'.

entry.title: Migrate Compose animations from CSS to JS
entry.content:
This CL moves the Compose animations from CSS to JS. This ultimately

will allow us to differentiate animations at load time vs. transitions

between screens, as we can play animations responding to initialization

and user clicks. It will also allow for easier animations of height

and fading out elements away.



Demo: http://screencast/cast/NjEyNDIxOTY3Mzg3MDMzNnwyNmI1ZGIzZi02Yw

entry.title: [PiP] Remove PictureInPictureWindowManager::GetActiveSessionOrigins
entry.content:
The interface is added in [1] for exposing active session origins to

Compute Pressure API [2]. However, according to discussions in [3],

this interface will expose cross-profile information and it is better

for Compute Pressure API to query the information within //content

layer. So this interface is useless and can be removed.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4853229

[2] https://www.w3.org/TR/compute-pressure/#dfn-document-has-implicit-focus

[3] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4956687/23..29/content/public/browser/web_contents_delegate.h#b787



Bug: none

Change-Id: Ie3d46fb57575dea957a26f32bca0660fad6e1bb6

Reviewed-by: Fr

entry.title: [Site search policy] Do not delete existing SEs on conflict
entry.content:
TemplateURLService can handle multiple SEs with the same keyword

(mostly due to extensions), so there is no need to delete existing

SEs in case of keyword conflict.



This CL ensures that the policy is not destructive - existing search

engines are never deleted, even if the user has never interacted with

them. In case of a keyword conflict between site search and and existing

engine, the following ordering is applied:

- If a keyword starts with "@", prefer the one set by site search policy

- Otherwise, prefer the one set by site search policy only if the user

interacted with it



There is no reason to add any extra validation for conflicts with DSP

set by policy - the corresponding policy handlers already take care of

potential scenarios.



Interactions with DSP not set by policy will be handled separately

(b/314162426).



Fixed: 314368463, 314359989

Bug: 314368463, 314359989

Change-Id: Ie03278ca7d6d0b48c59dfe9ed2af799d3afc8444

entry.title: [Rounded Windows] Add an UpdateRoundedWindows() method to the
entry.content:
ClientView class.



Rounding top-level windows in ChromeOS requires rounding the contents

of the ClientView, as ChromeOS does not have a border around the client

view. Additionally, ChromeOS renders content views via different

methods (simple web renderer, browser renderer, exo content), and

each ClientView has special logic to round the bottom two corners.



Therefore, the NonClientView must delegate part of the rounding logic

to the ClientView. This method allows various ClientViews to specify

their own rounding implementations.



Bug: b/316202840

Change-Id: I73f293c6bc2c670fe40c2f512df4e0c4729af94d

entry.title: [a11y] NextOnLine and PreviousOnLine not working with inert elements
entry.content:
A bug was found where AXObject::NextOnLine/PreviousOnLine were not

working when we had inert elements in the line.



So on a structure that looks like this:



this is broken



* "span1"'s NextOnLine would return nullptr.

* The last span's PreviousOnLine would return nullptr.



This CL fixes this bug by making sure we continue to move the cursor

until we find the next/previous non-inert in line element or until

we can't move the cursor anymore.



Change-Id: I900692aae3c538835960a15258b1f4708d918038

entry.title: [WhatsNew] Use FET to show What's new shortcut, new label badge and add control promo impressions.
entry.content:
This CL:



- Adds a new FET for the new label badge in the overflow menu and What's new shortcut that will check if user has seen the updated version of the What's new

- Adds promo eligibility conditions to FET (1. At least 14 days between promo displays, 2. This version has not been viewed 3. Chrome has opened at least 7 times)

- What's new promo, new label badge and shortcut will continue checking |WasWhatsNewUsed| along with the corresponding FET to avoid showing the current What's new to users who already seen the promo. This can be removed after new version of What's New.

- Cleans up unused user defaults

entry.title: Add WPT for referrer handling in HTTPS Upgrades
entry.content:
This WPT test checks that HTTPS Upgrading does not drop referrer

information when:

1. Referrer policy is no-referrer-when-downgrade

2. A navigation is made to an URL is HTTP

3. Navigated URL is successfully upgraded to HTTPS



In this scenario, the upgraded HTTPS URL should get the referrer

information since the connection was never downgraded to an unsafe

URL.



The current implementation of HTTPS Upgrades in Chrome doesn't pass

this test, dropping the referrer.



Bug: 1394910

entry.title: [Grid] Honor the specified width of a subgrid in its contribution size
entry.content:
1. Fixing the behavior of `GridLayoutAlgorithm` where the contribution

size of a subgrid in its standalone axis would ignore its specified

`width` and `[min|max]-width`, always using its intrinsic sizes.



This caused the columns of a subgrid to be sized incorrectly, while

the actual layout of the subgrid would not match its grid area.



2. Adding test coverage to the WPT suite for this issue.



Bug: 1475008

entry.title: documentScan: Add setOptions function
entry.content:
setOptions takes a scanner handle returned from openScanner and sets

zero or more supplied options to new values. The response includes the

result of setting each option and an updated set of option values in the

same format as the original response from openScanner.



The real work is done in DocumentScanAPIHandler::SetOptions. This CL

adds the JS function entry points and the matching apitests.

entry.title: [Site search policy] Create featured entries for @ state
entry.content:
This CL creates the TemplateURL entries that will be shown as featured

on the Omnibox when the user types "@".



If an entry is featured by policy, the policy handler creates an extra

TemplateURL with `featured_by_policy` set as true and `@` prepended to

the keyword. Entries with keywords not starting with `@` will always

have `featured_by_policy` set as false. The proposed approach will make

it much easier downstream to handle @ state.



Fixed: 309458462

entry.title: infra: Temporarily move linux_chromium_chromeos_asan_rel_ng to 16 cores
entry.content:
The builder has a worse than 50% infra-fail rate:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux_chromium_chromeos_asan_rel_ng



This is due to mem issues tracked in the linked bug. In the meantime,

to let folks use the trybot somewhat reliably, this temporarily moves

its build to 16 cores. This is what its CI bot uses, and it seems a bit

greener:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Builder



There also seems to be plenty of 16 core bot capacity for this:

https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/botlist?c=id&c=task&c=os&c=status&d=asc&f=builderless%3A1&f=cpu%3Ax86-64&f=os%3AUbuntu-22.04&f=pool%3Aluci.chromium.try&f=ssd%3A1&f=cores%3A16&s=id

entry.title: [Files F2] Fix the flaky tests for the new tree
entry.content:
In some tests we manually change the focus to the tree before

asserting the tree item is focused, this is flaky because the

focus might change to another element unexpectedly (e.g. file list)

before we do assertion with ":focus" selector.



Instead of ":focus", this CL just checks if the target element has

"tabindex=0" to assert if it's focusable or not.



Bug: 1510789

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*recentsNested*"

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*searchQueryLaunchParam*"

entry.title: Revert "[sidepanelpinning] Make button check anchor count when made visible."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 84550853e3ad44bdaa9a1beca41e5fbe93db2881.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5723956747173888



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8761719790013405345

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ExitTypeServiceTest.CloseCrashBubbleEnablesSaving](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FExitTypeServiceTest.CloseCrashBubbleEnablesSaving?q=VHash%3A538f26dad221c8a8)

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ExitTypeServiceTest.CrashCrashNewBrowser](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FExitTypeServiceTest.CrashCrashNewBrowser?q=VHash%3A538f26dad221c8a8)

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ExitTypeServiceTest.RestoreFromCrashBubble](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FExitTypeServiceTest.RestoreFromCrashBubble?q=VHash%3A538f26dad221c8a8)

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SessionRestoreSilentLaunchTest.SilentLaunchAfterCrash](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FSessionRestoreSilentLaunchTest.SilentLaunchAfterCrash?q=VHash%3A538f26dad221c8a8)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5723956747173888&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5113040&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> [sidepanelpinning] Make button check anchor count when made visible.

>

> This issue is exposed when we add the anchor highlight before the button

> has been made visible due to animations. This change checks the buttons

> anchor count if visibility changes to true to update the highlight

> accordingly.

>

> This also fixes another bug where |anchor_count_| is not respected when

> a drag finishes.

entry.content:
The WebXR Cardboard feature has been shipped for two milestones now with

no regressions. This change removes the now-expired UI flag that would

allow disabling it, and also begins the work of removing the backend

that it replaced (GVR), by removing the appropriate flag entry points

for it, as well as the ability to create it as a provider. This also

deletes all tests for the GVR code and paves the way for removing the

GVR backend which should no longer be used.

entry.title: Add metric tracking initial display time for first print
entry.content:
Add another metric related to tracking the time from when print preview

is initiated until the initial preview is available for rendering.

This new metric captures this same time, but only for the first

instance of the print preview since the browser started. This can be

used to illustrate additional costs that might happen when starting

the print preview, such as loading library dependencies.

entry.title: documentScan: Add API handler for setOptions
entry.content:
This adds the data types and flow for the new documentScan.setOptions

function. After the caller has opened a scanner with openScanner, they

can use setOptions to configure all of the available scanner options.

Each call attempts to set all provided options in order and returns a

new configuration after everything has been set.



Validation of constraints and value-option type matching happens on the

backend, so this logic is not duplicated in the handler. In most cases,

the handler just passes requests and responses directly to and from the

crosapi service.



The exception to this rule is that the incoming OptionSetting::Value

objects have some potential confusion between long and double due to the

combination of OptionValue union types, Javascript use of double for all

numbers, and the auto-generated IDL handling of lists:



1. If a type union contains multiple list types, the auto-generated

parsing code always attempts to populate the first list. Because a

double can't be parsed into an integer, this means that double[] has

to come before long[] in type signatures that accept both. This

means that the C++ side will always see the as_numbers field for

lists even if the caller wrote something like [1, 2, 3].

2. If a numeric value in JS ends with .0, the extension framework parses

it into an integer. This means that a caller supplying 1.0 in a

value arrives on the C++ side in the as_integer field.

3. Because of #2, even if the list confusion from #1 is fixed, the

opposite problem could happen where [1.0, 2.0, 3.0] is seen as

as_integers on the C++ side.



To address all of these, the handler does two types of re-mappings from

OptionSetting objects coming in from JS:



1. If an OptionSetting has type TYPE_FIXED but the value is in one of

the int fields, simply move the value over to the fixed field. This

technically allows callers to write NN instead of NN.0, but this

isn't a problem because the two values are numerically identical.

2. If an OptionSetting has type TYPE_INT but the value is in one of the

fixed fields, move the value over only if it is within the range of

int32_t and does not contain a non-zero fractional part. This

catches the cases where the framework parses an integer value into

the as_number/as_numbers field without allowing the user to silently

convert other types of doubles into integer options.



The same re-mapping concerns do not apply to structures that go in the

other direction because the C++ code is able to correctly distinguish

as_integer/as_number/as_integers/as_numbers when converting from mojom

structures. Nevertheless, this change also re-orders the relevant union

declarations in the IDL for consistency.



Bug: b:297435721

Change-Id: Idbe5e3ad6bee8032058574f16748ad2a4fc765d1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5096073

entry.title: [soft navigations] Remove ScriptState from SoftNavigationEventScope
entry.content:
The ScriptState was ultimately being used for ResetPaintsIfNeeded() in

order to get the frame (via ToLocalFrameIfNotDetached) -- but this

isn't necessary. SoftNavigationHeuristics is a supplement of

LocalDOMWindow -- so we can get the frame from the supplementable and

check whatever properties are needed. This avoids needing to create

any v8 locals when we just need to query dom object properties.

entry.title: Update resetInternal to explicitly reset recording
entry.content:
BaseRenderingContext2D::ResetInternal wasn't explicitly resetting the

recording. It was depending on a side effect of calling clearRect,

which has an overdraw optimization clearing the recording if the rect

extents covers the whole canvas. To make this work however,

ResetInternal has to hack into the canvas, manually resetting it to

its default state, or else, any transform or clip would prevent the

overdraw optimization to run.



Moreover, the overdraw optimization can actually be disabled via the

kDisableCanvasOverdrawOptimization feature. Doing so would actually

break ResetInternal, preventing it from dropping the previous recording.



Apart from this, the manual reset of the canvas is an abuse of

responsibility and an encapsulation problem. A follow up CL will split

the recording in two parts and this code would need to be updated to

correctly maintain the split recording state. It's much cleaner to

delegate that logic to the right abstraction.



Bug: 1484741

Change-Id: Ica3257f8ad38b98b0c9e9346697d0d229f2b40c1

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[CodeHealth] Avoid GC-forbidden field in PeerConnectionDependencyFactory""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5fb945fca94773fb76395821493abaad44d791cb.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5696909970767872



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8761721764142008289

Affected test(s):

[ninja://third_party/blink/renderer/controller:blink_unittests_v2/PeerConnectionDependencyFactoryTest.CreateRTCPeerConnectionHandler](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fthird_party%2Fblink%2Frenderer%2Fcontroller:blink_unittests_v2%2FPeerConnectionDependencyFactoryTest.CreateRTCPeerConnectionHandler?q=VHash%3Aa6cd4103710a7e7f)

entry.title: Remove SafeBrowsingExtensionProtectionAllowed policy
entry.content:
SafeBrowsingExtensionProtectionAllowed was added to Chrome on CrOS in

M114 as unlisted. Since Standard Safe Browsing is an essential service

for Data Processor Mode on ChromeOS, this policy is no longer needed.

Since the policy was never added to Admin Console and no UI was added

to allow end-users to set the policy, the pref and policy can be removed

completely.



BYPASS_POLICY_COMPATIBILITY_CHECK=The policy was never exposed to

end-users on Admin Console and was left as unlisted.

entry.title: shortcuts: Reset keyDisplay on key release
entry.content:
Problem:

1. Currently, when keyDisplay is set to an empty string (''), it

unexpectedly get set back later. Therefore, releasing key won't

reset keyDisplay.

2. When multiple keys are pressed, releasing the first key sets

keyDisplay to empty. However, releasing a second key changes

keyDisplay to that second key's value, which is not the intended

behavior.



Fix:

1. Use `updatedKeyEvent` to update keyDisplay and set

`pendingKeyEvent` to `updatedKeyEvent` afterwards.

2. Remove that condition where keyDisplay must match the previously

released key.



Before: http://go/scrcast/NTE1MDA0ODk0OTEwODczNnw5YjE2NDkxMC1hZA

After: http://go/scrcast/NjE2ODk1NDM0MTk0OTQ0MHwzMmU2OGY3NC1lOA

entry.title: WebUI: Replace FlattenedNodeObserver usage in cr-action-menu.
entry.content:
Replacing with a native API alternative, by leveraging the 'slotchange'

event instead. Note that FlattenedNodeObserver was also using the

'slotchange' event internally, but was also handling more cases that

don't seem needed of cr-action-menu's case.



This is in preparation of possibly migrating CrActionMenuElement to

Lit, and therefore removing any dependencies to Polymer

(FlattenedNodeObserver is provided by Polymer).

entry.title: [E2E] Add padding to snackbar views
entry.content:
This CL introduces a EdgeToEdgeSupplier to publish the change of

the edge to edge padding. The subscriber can subscribe to it in order

to add/remove paddings depending on the `toEdge` state.



SimpleEdgeToEdgePadAdjuster is a default implementation which can

add/remove paddings directly to the target view.

entry.title: [ImprovedDownloadWarnings] Hook up suspicious warning bypass
entry.content:
This hooks up the new WebUI download warning bypass flow for suspicious

files to the mojo browser interface, adding a new method to support the

new flow: For "suspicious" downloads, we can now validate the file

directly from the downloads page without any prompt. This requires a

user gesture on the WebContents. ("Suspicious" in this context includes

insecure downloads, and is in contrast to "Dangerous" warning bypass

which will be implemented in the next CL, crrev.com/c/5117338.)



Also modernizes/cleans up histogram definitions. Also adds interactive

ui tests for the new flow and for some existing downloads page

functionality.



Internal CL for csd.proto: cl/590626956



Screencasts:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1n8LCX58cahKndUG7vWP8ukDM7Cx5DYBb
